data.title: Coe Secures Spot in 2024 A-R-C Baseball Tournament Championship
data.meta_description: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa – Day two of the 2024 American Rivers Conference (A-R-C) Baseball Tournament saw top-seeded Coe College advance to the championship game of the double elimination tournament by virtue of the winner’s bracket. No. 2-seeded Buena Vista University, who fell to Coe 4-3 in game six, advanced to Saturday, where they will face No. 5 Loras College in an elimination game.
data.text:
Buena Vista and Loras Vie for a Spot in the Finale

5/10/2024 9:48:34 PM

CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa – Day two of the 2024 American Rivers Conference (A-R-C) Baseball Tournament saw top-seeded Coe College advance to the championship game of the double elimination tournament by virtue of the winner’s bracket. No. 2-seeded Buena Vista University, who fell to Coe 4-3 in game six, advanced to Saturday, where they will face No. 5 Loras College in an elimination game.

Following game six of the tournament, where No. 1 Coe College knocked off No. 2 Buena Vista University, No. 3 Luther College and No. 6 Wartburg College squared off in the tournament’s second elimination game (Game 7). The Norse stayed alive with a 4-3 victory. Luther turned around to face fifth-seeded Loras in another elimination game (Game 8), where the Duhawks came out on top by a score of 14-2.

Game Recaps, Friday, May 10

Game 6 - No. 1 Coe 4 vs. No. 2 Buena Vista 3

Team 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 R H E No. 2 Buena Vista 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 3 0 3 10 0 No. 1 Coe 0 1 0 2 0 1 0 0 X 4 9 0

WP - Ethan O'Donnell (6-1); LP - Ean McDaniel (7-3)

The Kohawks had three players with two hits in Mitchell Eckardt, Ryan Thoreson, and Tyce Johnson. Thoreson, Jack Allison, Johnson, and Creighton Kreshel each recorded an RBI in today's game. Starting on the mound and earning his sixth win of the season was Ethan O'Donnell who pitched 7.2 innings. He allowed three runs on nine hits while striking out three batters. Earning the save for Coe was Xander Cloudy who pitched the final 1.1 innings giving up one hit and recording one strikeout. Game 7 - No. 3 Luther 4 vs. No. 6 Wartburg 3

Team 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 R H E No. 6 Wartburg 0 0 0 1 0 0 2 0 0 3 7 0 No. 3 Luther 0 1 0 0 2 0 0 1 X 4 8 0

LP - Kyle Thompson (1-2)

Luther's Will Heithoff was the lone Norse to record multiple hits as he went 2-for-3 with an RBI. Also picking up RBIs were Mark Prince and Peyton Lindmark, who scored the game winning run in the bottom of the eighth via a solo homerun. Charles Running was the starting pitcher for the Norse, throwing seven full innings. Running allowed three runs on six hits while striking out two and walking two. Tyrus Werner came in for relief for the final two innings where he recorded a strikout and gave up just one hit. Game 8 - No. 5 Loras 14 vs. No. 3 Luther 2

Team 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 R H E No. 5 Loras 6 2 1 4 1 0 0 14 17 1 No. 3 Luther 0 0 1 0 0 0 1 2 6 0

WP - TJ Boyd (5-4); LP - CJ Boudreaux (1-2)

In the night-cap, the Loras Duhawks started strong and never looked back, even throughout a small rain delay. Loras had six players with a multi-hit game. Max McCallum was the leader as he went 4-for-5 from the leadoff spot, recording two RBIs and scoring two runs. Cody Sunny led the Duhawks with four RBIs, while Jackson Cullen and Nick DiBendetto each added two. Pitching a complete seven-inning victory was Tj Boyd who gave up just one earned run on six hits and two walks. Boyd struck out five Norse batters on the day. The final day of the 2024 A-R-C Baseball Tournament will begin with an elimination game between No. 2 Buena Vista and No. 5 Loras at 11:00a. The Coe Kohawks will await the winner of Buena Vista/Loras, for a championship showdown at 2:00p. Should Coe drop the championship game, there will be a winner take all game at 5:00p, with the tournament title and conference’s AQ to the 2024 NCAA Division III Tournament on the line.

Coe is chasing the fifth conference tournament title in program history with the most recent coming in 2022. The Kohawks are in the championship game for the ninth time: 2011, 2012, 2013, 2015, 2017, 2019, 2021, 2022, 2024).

Buena Vista is looking to advance to their fifth conference tournament championship game (2010, 2012, 2014, 2019) while also looking for their fourth tournament title (2010, 2015, 2019).

Loras is looking to advance to their fifth conference tournament championship game (1998, 2000, 2008, 2023) while also looking for their second-straight tournament title. The winner of the double-elimination tournament receives the American Rivers Conference’s automatic bid to the 2024 NCAA Division III Baseball Tournament. The regional round takes place May 17-19 followed by the 16-team super regional round the following weekend (May 24-25). Eight teams will emerge from the super regional round to take the field at Classic Park in Eastlake, Ohio for the NCAA Division III Baseball Championships, May 21 - June 6. The North Coast Athletic Conference and Greater Cleveland Sports Commission will host the Division III College World Series in 2042, 2025, and 2026.

American Rivers Conference Baseball Tournament Schedule:

Thursday, May 9

Game 1 - 11:00a - No. 3 Luther, 1 vs. No. 6 Wartburg, 8

Game 2 - 11:00a - No. 4 Dubuque, 3 vs. No. 5 Loras, 4

Game 3 - 2:00p - No. 5 Loras, 4 vs. No. 1 Coe, 6

Game 5 - 3:00p - No. 3 Luther, 9 vs. No. 4 Dubuque, 8

Game 4 - 5:00p - No. 6 Wartburg, 2 vs. No. 2 Buena Vista, 3

Friday, May 10 (All Games at Veterans Memorial Stadium)

Game 6 - 12:00p - No. 1 Coe, 4 vs. No. 2 Buena Vista, 3

Game 7 - 3:00p - No. 3 Luther, 4 vs. No. 6 Wartburg, 3

Game 8 - 6:00p - No. 3 Luther, 2 vs. No. 5 Loras, 14

Exception: If one of the Game 3 or 4 Losers already has had a bye, that team will play in Game 7, regardless of seed.

Saturday, May 11 (All Games at Veterans Memorial Stadium)

Game 9 - 11:00a - No. 5 Loras vs. No. 2 Buena Vista

Game 10 - 2:00p - No. 1 Coe vs. Game 9 Winner

Game 11 - 5:00p - Game 6 Winner vs. Game 9 Winner (if necessary)

Don't forget to become a fan of the American Rivers Conference on Facebook @AmericanRiversConference, X (Twitter) @AmerRiversConf, and Instagram @AmericanRiversConference.

About the American Rivers Conference

The Conference dates back to December 8, 1922, when representatives from 12 colleges got together and formed the "Iowa Intercollegiate Athletic Association." Honoring its heritage in Iowa and its expansion outside the state, the American Rivers Conference brand was established on August 9, 2018, to build on the academic and athletic success provided by its legacy, the Iowa Intercollegiate Athletic Conference. The A-R-C has nine full-time members: Buena Vista University, Central College, Coe College, University of Dubuque, Loras College, Luther College, Nebraska Wesleyan University, Simpson College, and Wartburg College.
